description: {"blocks":[{"key":"335q7","text":"The novel methodology developed by Mochales-Riaño \u0026 Barroso et al. (in press) for experimentally obtaining thermal exchange rates of small lizards through the use of radiometric videos, underpinned the need to devise a thermal video processing protocol to standardize this data collection. This protocol addresses this need as it represents a subsequently optimized version of the processing pipeline used for the aforementioned proof-of-concept study.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53arp","text":"This protocol was used to successfully obtain temperature data from several body parts from thermoregulating lizards, enabling internal body temperature to be inferred (as per Barroso et al., 2016 and 2020), as well as providing insights into thermal exchange rates and the patterns of regional heterothermy and temperature redistribution in these animals.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g3gu","text":"So far, variants of this video analysis protocol have been successfully deployed in several ongoing research projects, on several species of lizards.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

documents.ofn: Illustrated Protocol for Processing Radiometric Videos Using the Software FLIR Tools.pdf

ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"97pns","text":"This protocol deals with the processing pipeline for non-invasive radiometric videos previously recorded from animals thermoregulating. It does not deal with the method for obtaining said videos and hence no animal needs to be involved for the direct deployment of this protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fihk2","text":"Images/videos/screenshots shown in this protocol were sourced from research projects by the Author (and colleagues) where the relevant permits and ethical approvals were obtained for the safe handling and recording of the pictured animals. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Fundação Para a Ciência e a Tecnologia
Fundação Para a Ciência e a Tecnologia

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8aa7o","text":"When processing multiple videos for posterior comparison of data, it is recommended that said processing is done by the same person in order to avoid any operator bias. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
image_attribution: {"blocks":[{"key":"dmaq8","text":"All images by the Author, Frederico M Barroso, except the diagram of the lizards head kindly donated by Giulia Simbula.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: thermal imaging, radiometric videos, FLIR, thermal video processing, thermal physiology

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working
